stanza.line: But do thy worst to steal thy self (a)away(/a)
For term of life thou art assured (b)mine(/b)
And life no longer than thy love will (a)stay(/a)
For it depends upon that love of (b)thine(/b)
Then need I not to fear the worst of (c)wrongs(/c)
When in the least of them my life hath (d)end(/d)
I see a better state to me (c)belongs(/c)
Than that which on thy humour doth (d)depend(/d)
Thou canst not vex me with inconstant (e)mind(/e)
Since that my life on thy revolt doth (f)lie(/f)
O what a happy title do I (e)find(/e)
Happy to have thy love happy to (f)die(/f)
But what's so blessed-fair that fears no (g)blot(/g)
Thou mayst be false and yet I know it (g)not(/g)
